parameters.name: game
parameters.help: Reference to the current game instance.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: Asset key for the sound.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.help: Default value for the volume, between 0 and 1.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.help: Whether or not the sound will loop.

public.name: addMarker
public.help: Adds a marker into the current Sound. A marker is represented by a unique key and a start time and duration.\nThis allows you to bundle multiple sounds together into a single audio file and use markers to jump between them for playback.

parameters.name: name
parameters.help: A unique name for this marker, i.e. 'explosion', 'gunshot', etc.

parameters.name: start
parameters.help: The start point of this marker in the audio file, given in seconds. 2.5 = 2500ms, 0.5 = 500ms, etc.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.help: The duration of the marker in seconds. 2.5 = 2500ms, 0.5 = 500ms, etc.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.help: The volume the sound will play back at, between 0 (silent) and 1 (full volume).

parameters.name: loop
parameters.help: Sets if the sound will loop or not.

public.name: destroy
public.help: Destroys this sound and all associated events and removes it from the SoundManager.

parameters.name: remove
parameters.help: If true this Sound is automatically removed from the SoundManager.

public.name: fadeIn
public.help:
Starts this sound playing (or restarts it if already doing so) and sets the volume to zero.
Then increases the volume from 0 to 1 over the duration specified.
At the end of the fade Sound.onFadeComplete is dispatched with this Sound object as the first parameter,
and the final volume (1) as the second parameter.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.help: The time in milliseconds over which the Sound should fade in.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.help: Should the Sound be set to loop? Note that this doesn't cause the fade to repeat.

public.name: fadeOut
public.help: Decreases the volume of this Sound from its current value to 0 over the duration specified.\nAt the end of the fade Sound.onFadeComplete is dispatched with this Sound object as the first parameter,\nand the final volume (0) as the second parameter.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.help: The time in milliseconds over which the Sound should fade out.

public.name: fadeTo
public.help: Fades the volume of this Sound from its current value to the given volume over the duration specified.\nAt the end of the fade Sound.onFadeComplete is dispatched with this Sound object as the first parameter,\nand the final volume (volume) as the second parameter.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.help: The time in milliseconds during which the Sound should fade out.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.help: The volume which the Sound should fade to. This is a value between 0 and 1.

public.name: play
public.help: Play this sound, or a marked section of it.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.help: If you want to play a marker then give the key here, otherwise leave blank to play the full sound.

parameters.name: position
parameters.help: The starting position to play the sound from - this is ignored if you provide a marker.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.help: Volume of the sound you want to play. If none is given it will use the volume given to the Sound when it was created (which defaults to 1 if none was specified).

parameters.name: loop
parameters.help: Loop when it finished playing?

parameters.name: forceRestart
parameters.help: If the sound is already playing you can set forceRestart to restart it from the beginning.

public.name: removeMarker
public.help: Removes a marker from the sound.

parameters.name: name
parameters.help: The key of the marker to remove.

public.name: restart
public.help: Restart the sound, or a marked section of it.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.help: If you want to play a marker then give the key here, otherwise leave blank to play the full sound.

parameters.name: position
parameters.help: The starting position to play the sound from - this is ignored if you provide a marker.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.help: Volume of the sound you want to play.

parameters.name: loop
parameters.help: Loop when it finished playing?

protected.name: soundHasUnlocked
protected.help: Called automatically when this sound is unlocked.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The Phaser.Cache key of the sound file to check for decoding.

private.name: fadeComplete
private.help: Internal handler for Sound.fadeIn, Sound.fadeOut and Sound.fadeTo.

public.name: allowMultiple
public.inlineHelp: This will allow you to have multiple instances of this Sound playing at once. This is only useful when running under Web Audio, and we recommend you implement a local pooling system to not flood the sound channels.

public.name: autoplay
public.inlineHelp: Boolean indicating whether the sound should start automatically.

public.name: context
public.inlineHelp: Reference to the AudioContext instance.

public.name: currentMarker
public.inlineHelp: The string ID of the currently playing marker, if any.

public.name: currentTime
public.inlineHelp: The current time the sound is at.

public.name: duration
public.inlineHelp: The duration of the current sound marker in seconds.

public.name: durationMS
public.inlineHelp: The duration of the current sound marker in ms.

public.name: externalNode
public.inlineHelp: If defined this Sound won't connect to the SoundManager master gain node, but will instead connect to externalNode.

public.name: gainNode
public.inlineHelp: The gain node in a Web Audio system.

public.name: game
public.help: A reference to the currently running Game.

public.name: isDecoded
public.inlineHelp: Returns true if the sound file has decoded.

public.name: isDecoding
public.inlineHelp: Returns true if the sound file is still decoding.

public.name: isPlaying
public.inlineHelp: true if the sound is currently playing, otherwise false.

public.name: key
public.inlineHelp: Asset key for the sound.

public.name: loop
public.inlineHelp: Whether or not the sound or current sound marker will loop.

public.name: markers
public.inlineHelp: The sound markers.

public.name: masterGainNode
public.inlineHelp: The master gain node in a Web Audio system.

public.name: mute
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the muted state of this sound.

public.name: name
public.inlineHelp: Name of the sound.

public.name: onDecoded
public.inlineHelp: The onDecoded event is dispatched when the sound has finished decoding (typically for mp3 files)

public.name: onFadeComplete
public.inlineHelp: The onFadeComplete event is dispatched when this sound finishes fading either in or out.

public.name: onLoop
public.inlineHelp: The onLoop event is dispatched when this sound loops during playback.

public.name: onMarkerComplete
public.inlineHelp: The onMarkerComplete event is dispatched when a marker within this sound completes playback.

public.name: onMute
public.inlineHelp: The onMouse event is dispatched when this sound is muted.

public.name: onPause
public.inlineHelp: The onPause event is dispatched when this sound is paused.

public.name: onPlay
public.inlineHelp: The onPlay event is dispatched each time this sound is played.

public.name: onResume
public.inlineHelp: The onResume event is dispatched when this sound is resumed from a paused state.

public.name: onStop
public.inlineHelp: The onStop event is dispatched when this sound stops playback.

public.name: override
public.inlineHelp: if true when you play this sound it will always start from the beginning.

public.name: paused
public.inlineHelp: true if the sound is paused, otherwise false.

public.name: pausedPosition
public.inlineHelp: The position the sound had reached when it was paused.

public.name: pausedTime
public.inlineHelp: The game time at which the sound was paused.

public.name: pendingPlayback
public.inlineHelp: true if the sound file is pending playback

public.name: position
public.inlineHelp: The position of the current sound marker.

public.name: startTime
public.inlineHelp: The time the Sound starts at (typically 0 unless starting from a marker)

public.name: stopTime
public.inlineHelp: The time the sound stopped.

public.name: totalDuration
public.inlineHelp: The total duration of the sound in seconds.

public.name: usingAudioTag
public.inlineHelp: true if the sound is being played via the Audio tag.

public.name: usingWebAudio
public.inlineHelp: true if this sound is being played with Web Audio.

public.name: volume
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the volume of this sound, a value between 0 and 1.

private.name: _muted
private.inlineHelp: Boolean indicating whether the sound is muted or not.

private.name: _paused
private.inlineHelp: Was this sound paused via code or a game event?

private.name: _volume
private.inlineHelp: The global audio volume. A value between 0 (silence) and 1 (full volume).
